description: From Middle French superscript, from Latin superscriptus (“written above”).

entries.meaning: placed above the normal line of text
(typography) A type of lettering form that appears as a number, figure, or symbol above the normal line of type, located at the right or left of another symbol or text.

verbs.description: superscript (third-person singular simple present superscripts, present participle superscripting, simple past and past participle superscripted)

entries.meaning: (mathematics, sciences, typography, transitive, of a variable) To provide with a superscript.
examples: The ambient or unsaturated value of a variable is superscripted with a "*".

entries.meaning: (typography, transitive, of a text) To convert to a superscript form.
